Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the amount of earmark pork-barrel spending that Sen. Obama has requested, stating it as $932 million, while the actual amount is $931.3 million.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim does not falter at times.
Lack enough support: The claim is supported by the fact that Sen. Obama has requested $931.3 million in earmark pork-barrel spending.
Problematic assumption: There is no problematic assumption in the claim.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation provided in the claim.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Sen. Obama has eschewed any pork spending for fiscal 2009, as stated by Obama himself.
